metadata.title: CVE-2023-1972 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
A potential heap based buffer overflow was found in _bfd_elf_slurp_version_tables() in bfd/elf.c. This may lead to loss of availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-common - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-for-build - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-for-host - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-multiarch - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-source - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
libbinutils - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
libctf0 - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
libgprofng0 - 2.39-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.note: seth-arnold> binutils isn't safe for untrusted inputs. mdeslaur> buffer over-read, likely just a crash when parsing a corrupted file, setting priority to low

criterions.comment: binutils package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.39-3ubuntu1.2').
gdb package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
